noPrefixCheck.desc: Toggle Zebra / Quagga BGP Prefix Checks - use as last resort around Quagga 1.2.4 bug

neighbors.desc: The list of BGP neighbors. Map keys can be arbitrary strings and are ignored.

domainname.desc: The neighbor's domainname - Save a DNS lookup

hostname.desc: The neighbor's hostname - Save a DNS lookup

maximumPrefixes.desc: The maximum prefixes we can learn from our neighbor

keepalive.desc: The BGP keepalive period in seconds (default 10 seconds)

delegatedNetworkPrefixes.desc: Specific delegated network prefixes from nearby CPEs to be advertised via BGP (comma separated)

specificNetworkPrefixes.desc: Specific allocated network prefixes to be advertised via BGP (comma separated)

md5Password.desc: Clear text password to use for BGP MD5 challenges

cpePrefixesAutoAdvertisement.desc: Enable automatic advertisement of CPE prefixes, instead of static `cpeNetworkPrefix`

allowNonDefaultRoutes.desc: Allow non-default routes to be learned from BGP peers

keaEnabled.desc: Controls if dhcp is handled by Kea

prefixSplitEnabled.desc: Allow splitting prefixes down to /64 on Marvell Hardware

CPE_INTERFACE.desc: Enable CPE Interface Functionality on this interface

CPE_IFACE_IP_PREFIX.desc: Override prefix on CPE interface, instead of configuring from lo address

CPE_TUNNEL_ENDPOINT.desc: Enable L2 tunnel on CPE Interface

DPDK_ENABLED.desc: Use DPDK as the wireless driver

DVPP_ENABLED.desc: Use VPP directly with the Wigig kernel driver

E2E_ENABLED.desc: Enables E2E control-plane on device. E2E may be disabled for manual testing.

FB_DRIVER_VERBOSE.desc: Debug bitmask for FB driver, i.e. terragraph_{dhd,qca}. A value of 0 is treated as 0x10001. (0x1 = CTRL_ERROR, 0x2 = CTRL_DBG, 0x4 = CTRL_INFO, 0x8 = GPS_DBG, 0x10 = QUEUE_STATS_DBG, 0x20 = QUEUE_STATS_DISABLE_THROTTLE, 0x40 = CFG80211_DBG, 0x10000 = DATA_ERROR, 0x20000 = DATA_DBG, 0x40000 = DATA_INFO)

FW_IF2IF.desc: This param is deprecated. To be removed in release M18.

FW_LOGGING_ENABLED.desc: Enables firmware and microcode log collection. Not recommended for production use.

FW_LOGGING_FILE_COUNT.desc: When using 'FW_LOGGING_ENABLED', set the maximum number of log files retained

FW_LOGGING_FILESIZE_MB.desc: When using 'FW_LOGGING_ENABLED', set the maximum single uncompressed log file size (will be compressed when rotated)

FW_LOG_VERBOSE.desc: Logging verbosity for firmware and microcode logs. (0:default of ERROR+WARN+INFO, 1:ERROR, 2:+WARN, 3:+INFO, 4:+VERBOSE)

FW_USE_NATIVE_BOARDFILE.desc: Use manually calibrated native board file on each RF baseband by reading baseband eeprom

FW_TX_RING_DEPTH.desc: WiGig FW Tx ring depth using credits - does not alter actual Tx ring size (4096)

GPSD_BAUD_RATE.desc: Set the baud rate on GPSD_DEVICE (empty = use default)

GPSD_ENABLED.desc: Enables gpsd and timestamp forwarding via driver-if

GPSD_GPS_MODULE.desc: Name of the GPS module and vendor. This may enable module-specific functionality.

GPSD_NMEA_TIME_OFFSET.desc: The time offset calibration factor for NMEA messages from the GPS module (in other words, the latency between emitted time messages and 'real' time), in fractional seconds. If set, this is used as the NMEA refclock offset in chronyd.

GPSD_POSITION_HOLD_ENABLED.desc: When using gpsd, enable single-satellite mode operation on GPS devices which support it

GPSD_PPS_DEVICE.desc: Set the PPS device (ex. /dev/pps1), only required for syncing system time with NTP

HMAC_VERBOSE.desc: Debug level for MAC and PHY modules. (0:+error, 1:+hli, 2:+bh, 3:+inform,+trace)

LOGTAIL_ENABLED.desc: Enable Terragraph log tailer (e.g. if not using Fluent Bit)

OOB_INTERFACE.desc: Enable backdoor access for device recovery via an out-of-band interface

OOB_NETNS.desc: Put OOB interface in its own linux namespace, if enabled

OPENR_ENABLE_SPARK2.desc: Enable Open/R Spark2 functionality in favor of Spark1

OPENR_ENABLE_DEPRECATED_PREFIXES.desc: Enable compatibility between Open/R versions before/after release M80. E2E minion will inject prefix entries into KvStore to support the deprecated Open/R prefix format.

OPENR_USE_FIB_NSS.desc: Use NSS (Marvell A390x Network Subsystem) hardware acceleration for packet forwarding

OPENR_USE_FIB_VPP.desc: Program routes learned via Open/R into VPP's FIB

OPENR_LINK_FLAP_MAX_BACKOFF_MS.desc: Open/R link flap max backoff time(ms)

OPENR_IFACE_PREFIXES.desc: Open/R CSV list of interfaces to run on - Can be a prefix/substr of interface name. Deprecated in favor of 'OPENR_IFACE_REGEX_INCLUDE'

OPENR_IFACE_REGEX_INCLUDE.desc: Regular expression of the interfaces Open/R runs on

OPENR_VERBOSE.desc: Logging verbosity for Open/R. Show all VLOG(m) messages for m <= this

MINION_VERBOSE.desc: Logging verbosity for E2E minion. Show all VLOG(m) messages for m <= this

MINION_VMODULE.desc: Logging verbosity for specific modules in E2E minion ('-vmodule' flag). Show all VLOG(m) messages for m <= this

SLIP_BAUD_RATE.desc: Baud rate for SLIP UART. Note that before changing this value, the ESP32 configuration needs to be updated to match (make_esp32_cfg -w -b <BAUD_RATE> -f)

SLIP_SERIAL_PORT.desc: SLIP serial port for ESP32 WiFi (e.g. /dev/ttyS2)

SNMP_ENABLED.desc: Enables SNMP and TG SNMP agent daemons

STATS_AGENT_VERBOSE.desc: Logging verbosity for stats agent. Show all VLOG(m) messages for m <= this

TIMEZONE.desc: Linux zoneinfo timezone name to set on nodes

UDP_PING_SERVER_ENABLED.desc: Enable UDP ping server on the node

VPP_COREDUMP_ENABLED.desc: Capture core dumps when VPP crashes. This can take a very long time (minutes), and is not recommended for production use.

VPP_DPDK_LOG_STR.desc: Comma-separated DPDK debug log settings, used for device-specific debug logs, e.g. "pmd.wil.wmi:debug". For wil6210 logs see the source file wil6210_debug.c for options. For DPAA2 logs use pmd.net.dpaa2 and bus.fslmc. See log levels in dpdk/lib/librte_eal/include/rte_log.h (8 is debug).

VPP_FW_RECOVERY_ENABLED.desc: Enable VPP to restart Wigig devices that experience firmware errors; otherwise VPP crashes on device firmware error.

VPP_ULA_TEST_PREFIX.desc: Define a /64 IPv6 ULA test prefix that will never be forwarded to Linux over slowpath.  This is useful for performance testing and is not recommended for production use.

VPP_USE_EEPROM_MACS.desc: When using VPP, use radio MAC addresses from the digital board EEPROM instead of OTP MAC addresses

WEBUI_ENABLED.desc: Enables HTTP server for controlling minion.

kvstoreParams.desc: The Open/R KvStore keys and values

e2e-ctrl-url.desc: The E2E controller URL (in ZMQ socket endpoint format), e.g. "tcp://[2001::1]:7007"

e2e-ctrl-url-backup.desc: The E2E backup controller URL (in ZMQ socket endpoint format), e.g. "tcp://[2001::2]:7007"

e2e-aggr-url.desc: The NMS aggregator URL (in ZMQ socket endpoint format), e.g. "tcp://[2001::1]:8002". Multiple URLs can be provided (for load balancing) by adding additional keys prefixed with this key's name, e.g. "e2e-aggr-url-2".

e2e-network-prefix.desc: The Terragraph network seed prefix and allocation prefix length (in CIDR format, followed by a comma and then the bit-length of prefixes allocated to each node), e.g. "3001::/56,64"

controlSuperframe.desc: Control superframe for the link (0-1: DN-DN link, 0-15: DN-CN link, 255: Auto-assign by fw)

laConvergenceFactordBperSFQ8.desc: Controls how quickly the outer loop offset (in dB) will change ([0.1-1]dB in Q8 notation)

respNodeType.desc: Node type of the responder (1: CN, 2: DN)

softDisable.desc: Soft drain this link by setting a very high link metric (overrides all other metrics)

txIdeal.desc: The ideal TX airtime fraction to the link (in 1/100%)

txMin.desc: The minimum TX airtime fraction to the link (in 1/100%)

txMax.desc: The maximum TX airtime fraction to the link (in 1/100%)

rxIdeal.desc: The ideal RX airtime fraction from the link (in 1/100%)

rxMin.desc: The minimum RX airtime fraction from the link (in 1/100%)

rxMax.desc: The maximum RX airtime fraction from the link (in 1/100%)

eventFilters.desc: Generate events from log lines using a regular expression. Map keys represent names with which events will be published.

regex.desc: Regular expression that indicates the event has occurred

level.desc: Event level to assign if the regular expression matches

enabled.desc: Enables adaptive Open/R link metric changes based on current link statistics

metricMap.desc: The map of MCS to Open/R link metric

tokenGenRate.desc: The number of tokens to generate per second for the token bucket rate-limiter on link metric changes

tokenBurstSize.desc: The maximum burst size for the token bucket rate-limiter on link metric changes

successiveChangeCount.desc: The number of successive link metric changes (in one direction) required before actually switching link metric

GW_ADDR.desc: The IP address of the Gateway (link-local IP)

NAT64_IPV6_PREFIX.desc: NAT64 IPv6 prefix. Can use 64:ff9b::/96 (well-known prefix).

NAT64_POP_ENABLED.desc: Enable NAT64 on POP interface for IPv6 <-> IPv4 NAT

POP_ADDR.desc: The IP address of the interface on the POP node that routes to the gateway

POP_ADDR_PREFIX_LEN.desc: The IP address prefix length of the interface on the POP node that routes to the gateway

POP_BGP_ROUTING.desc: Enable BGP routing on the POP

POP_IFACE.desc: The interface on the POP node that routes traffic to the Gateway

POP_VLAN_ID.desc: The VLAN of interface on the POP node that routes traffic to the Gateway

POP_STATIC_ROUTING.desc: Enable static routing on the POP

VPP_ADDR.desc: The IP address of the interface within VPP on the POP node (Fast Path edge address)

beamConfig.desc: Enum indicating beam forming mode (0: Deprecated, 1: Use [tx|rx]BeamIndex specified in config, 2: Use indices from the BF scan)

bfAgc.desc: [Test-only] AGC to use in BF Slots (33279: Use free running AGC, [?]: Max or Freeze AGC)

bfMode.desc: Enum to choose between different beamforming modes (0: Disable BF scan, 1: Enable initial BF scan)

cb2Enable.desc: Enable channel bonding (CB2) mode (0: Disabled, 1: Enabled)

forceGpsDisable.desc: Boolean to prevent GPS sync check at initiator/responder during assoc (0: Enable sync check, 1: Disable sync check)

gpioConfig.desc: [Deprecated] Param to set output on GPIO for open board debug. (0: MAC scheduler debug, 1: Air Tx/Rx mode, 2: Tx beam read, 3: Rx beam read)

key0.desc: This param is deprecated. To be removed in release M18.

key1.desc: This param is deprecated. To be removed in release M18.

key2.desc: This param is deprecated. To be removed in release M18.

key3.desc: This param is deprecated. To be removed in release M18.

laConvergenceFactordBperSFQ8.desc: Controls how quickly the outer loop offset (in dB) will change ([0.1-1]dB in Q8 notation)

laInvPERTarget.desc: PER target is 1/laInvPERTarget - for example, for 1e-3 PER target set laInvPERTarget to 1000

laMaxMcs.desc: Max MCS when link adaptation is enabled. (i.e.: mcs=35)

laMinMcs.desc: Min MCS when link adaptation is enabled. i.e.: mcs=35)

latpc100PercentPERDrop.desc: Configure 100% PER offset drop, allow TPC disable, and calibration filtering (see documents)

latpcUseIterations.desc: The LA TPC joint algorithm will adjust the offset using LDPC iterations if latpcUseIterations is set (0: Disabled, 1: Enabled)

linkAgc.desc: AGC to use in Data Slots (33269: Use free running AGC, [bit 15]: Max(1) or Freeze(0) AGC)

linkImpairmentDetectionEnable.desc: Flag to enable/disable link impairment detection

linkImpairmentLongPending.desc: Time a link has to stay in LONGLINKPENDINGTIME before move to LINK_UP (Unit is SF, 1.6ms)

linkImpairmentShortPending.desc: Time a link has to stay in SHORTLINKPENDINGTIME before move to SHORT_LINK_UP (Unit is SF, 1.6ms)

linkImpairmentShortUp.desc: Time a link has to stay in SHORTLINKUPTIME before move to LINK_UP (Unit is SF, 1.6ms)

lsmAssocRespAckTimeout.desc: Timeout (in ms) on reception of Assoc Resp Ack at responder

lsmAssocRespTimeout.desc: Timeout (in ms) on reception of Assoc Resp at initiator

lsmFirstHeartbTimeout.desc: Wait time (in ms) for first heartbeat after completion of association procedure

lsmRepeatAck.desc: Number of retransmissions of Assoc Resp Ack

lsmRepeatAckInterval.desc: Interval (in ms) between retransmissions of Assoc Resp Ack by initiator

lsmSendAssocReqRetry.desc: Max number of retries by initiator when waiting for Assoc Resp

lsmSendAssocRespRetry.desc: Max number of retries by responder when waiting for Assoc Resp Ack

maxAgcIfGaindBperIndexQ8.desc: Gain per IF index in dB (Q8).  Only used when maxAgcUseRssi is not enabled.

maxAgcMaxIfSweetGainRange.desc: Upper end of the desired IF gain range

maxAgcMinIfSweetGainRange.desc: Lower end of the desired IF gain range

maxAgcMinRssi.desc: Used if maxAgcUseMinRssi is set. This will be the minRssi set if maxAgcTracking is not enabled (otherwise the algorithm will overwrite it)

maxAgcRawAdcScaleFactorQ8.desc: Number of dB per index for the raw ADC RSSI in Q8 (e.g. 0.5 would mean 0.5dB per raw ADC RSSI index)

maxAgcRfGaindBperIndexQ8.desc: Gain per RF index in dB (Q8).  Only used when maxAgcUseRssi is not enabled.

maxAgcRfGainHiLo.desc: Vendor proprietary.  Bit 0 enables, bits [15:8] are threshold in dB

maxAgcTargetRawAdc.desc: The nominal raw ADC RSSI level

maxAgcTrackingEnabled.desc: If not enabled, max AGC will be set to linkAgc - otherwise, linkAgc will be overwritten as soon as the max AGC tracking algorithm starts (0: Disabled, 1: Enabled)

maxAgcTrackingMargindB.desc: The amount by which the max AGC is set higher than the AGC that corresponds to the current IIR averaged rssi - the larger this value, the more conservative in terms of the max AGC causing PER but the less effective the AGC will be to combat early-weak interference ([0-50]dB)

maxAgcUseMinRssi.desc: Set to 1 to use min RSSI; otherwise use max AGC

maxAgcUseSameForAllSta.desc: Set to 1 to apply the same min RSSI or max AGC to all stations in a P2MP setting; otherwise each station is configured independently

maxTxPower.desc: The maximum Tx power index assigned when TPC algorithm is enabled

maxTxPowerSet1.desc: The maximum Tx power index assigned while set1RficBitmap is active in massive if set1RficBitmap!=set2RficBitmap

autoPbfMtpoTxPower.desc: Tx Power used by autoPBF when MTPO succeeds.

mcs.desc: MCS used by transmitter (1-16: Static MCS, 35: Joint LA-TPC)

minRssi.desc: [Test-only] RSSI threshold used for packet detection

minTxPower.desc: The minimum Tx power index assigned when TPC algorithm is enabled

noLinkTimeout.desc: If no link is up for timeout minutes, fw will mark itself as not healthy - this will lead to minion restart ([1, 30000] (units = minutes))

numOfHbLossToFail.desc: Count of consecutive number of HBs that if lost will cause the link to be declared as a failure. Note: A HB is sent once every BWGD

polarity.desc: Polarity for the radio (1: ODD, 2: EVEN, 3: HYBRID_ODD, 4: HYBRID_EVEN)

restrictToSfParity.desc: Restrict scheduling to some superframes based on parity (0: No Restriction, 1: only schedule on odd superframes, 2: only schedule on even superframes)

rxBeamIndex.desc: The index of the Rx Beam when beamConfig==1

rxBuffer.desc: Block-ack receive window size ([8,63], but only 63 supported)

rxSlot0End.desc: Time (in us) from start of frame to end of Rx slot 0 ([1:399], but only default supported)

rxSlot0Start.desc: Time (in us) from start of frame to start of Rx slot 0 ([1:399], but only default supported)

rxSlot1End.desc: Time (in us) from start of frame to end of Rx slot 1 ([1:399], but only default supported)

rxSlot1Start.desc: Time (in us) from start of frame to start of Rx slot 1 ([1:399], but only default supported)

rxSlot2End.desc: Time (in us) from start of frame to end of Rx slot 2 ([1:399], but only default supported)

rxSlot2Start.desc: Time (in us) from start of frame to start of Rx slot 2 ([1:399], but only default supported)

statsLogInterval.desc: Periodicity (in ms) for logging of stats

statsPrintInterval.desc: Periodicity (in ms) for printing of per-station stats to kernel-log (0: Disable, [200:3600000]: Enable)

tpcAlphaDownRssiStep3Q10.desc: TPC step 3 (steady state) tpcAlphaXXXRssiStep3Q10 controls how quickly the algorithm tracks the RSSI, a larger value means it tracks more slowly. AlphaDown controls how quickly the RSSI is allowed to decrease setting ([0-1] in Q10 notation)

tpcAlphaUpRssiStep3Q10.desc: TPC step 3 (steady state) tpcAlphaXXXRssiStep3Q10 controls how quickly the algorithm tracks the RSSI, a larger value means it tracks more slowly. AlphaUp controls how quickly the RSSI is allowed to increase ([0-1] in Q10 notation)

tpcAlphaUpTargetRssiStep3Q10.desc: TPC step 3 (steady state) tpcAlphaXXXTargetRssiStep3Q10 controls how quickly the algorithm tracks the target RSSI, a larger value means it tracks more slowly ([0-1] in Q10 notation)

tpcEnable.desc: Enable Transmit Power Control (0: Disable, 1: after initial BF only, 2: after initial BF and assoc, 3: after initial BF, assoc, and steady-state)

tpcPBEnable.desc: Enable Transmit Power Control Power Boost (0: Disable, 1: Enable Power Boost option after initial BF, assoc, and steady-state)

txBeamIndex.desc: The index of the Tx Beam when beamConfig==1

txPowerTableLinear.desc: Use original transmit power table if 0, otherwise use 1dB per index

txSlot0End.desc: Time (in us) from start of frame to end of Tx slot 0 ([1:399], but only default supported)

txSlot0Start.desc: Time (in us) from start of frame to start of Tx slot 0 ([1:399], but only default supported)

txSlot1End.desc: Time (in us) from start of frame to end of Tx slot 1 ([1:399], but only default supported)

txSlot1Start.desc: Time (in us) from start of frame to start of Tx slot 1 ([1:399], but only default supported)

txSlot2End.desc: Time (in us) from start of frame to end of Tx slot 2 ([1:399], but only default supported)

txSlot2Start.desc: Time (in us) from start of frame to start of Tx slot 2 ([1:399], but only default supported)

wsecEnable.desc: Enable airlink encryption (0: Disabled, 1: Enabled, 2: Enabled with 802.1X)

maxTxPowerPerMcs.desc: Max Tx Power per MCS level (bits 0:7 MCS1-9, bits 8:15 MCS10, bits 16:23 MCS11, bits 24:31 MCS12)

maxTxPowerPerMcsEdmg.desc: Max Tx Power per MCS level (bits 0:7 MCS13, bits 8:15 MCS14, bits 16:23 MCS15, bits 24:31 MCS16)

noTrafficMaxMcsFallback.desc: Set max MCS to this level when there is no traffic

autoPbfEnable.desc: Enable or Disable AUTO PBF after link ignition

ibfProcedureType.desc: Type of IBF procedure to perform 0=Massive, 1=Diversity

ibfNumberOfBeams.desc: Number of beams to use during IBF procedure

ibfSet1RficBitmap.desc: Bitmap of RFIC to enable for ibfProcedureType Massive and Diversity set 1; behavior for all zeros is software-defined

ibfSet2RficBitmap.desc: Bitmap of RFIC to enable for ibfProcedureType Massive and Diversity set 2; For Massive ibfSet1RficBitmap and ibfSet2RficBitmap should be same; behavior for all zeros is software-defined

useUpdateAwvForPbf.desc: Use update AWV for PBF when applicable (as determined by firmware)

latpcBlerToPer.desc: The lower (bits 3:0) and upper (bits 7:4) bound for BLER to PER conversion as pwr of 2

mcsLqmQ3_1_4.desc: Packed MCS table for MCS 1-4 in Q3 (times 2^3) with 8 lsbs -> MCS1

mcsLqmQ3_5_8.desc: Packed MCS table for MCS 5-8 in Q3 (times 2^3) with 8 lsbs -> MCS5

mcsLqmQ3_9_12.desc: Packed MCS table for MCS 9-12 in Q3 (times 2^3) with 8 lsbs -> MCS9

mcsLqmQ3_13_16.desc: Packed MCS table for MCS 13-16 in Q3 (times 2^3) with 8 lsbs -> MCS13 (EDMG only)

ibfUseRssi.desc: Flag to use RSSI instead of SNR as initial beamforming criteria

rxMaxMcs.desc: Max MCS value supported during reception by the node (based on PCIE and CPU capabilities)

tcpTuningConfig.desc: TCP performance tuning configuration (LSB byte - Slot efficiency factor [1% - 100%]; MSB byte - TCP headroom [0 - 64 frames])

htsfMsgInterval.desc: Periodicity (in BWGDs) for sending HTSF Info messages to host (0 - Disable, 1 - sent once every BWGD (~25ms), 40 - sent once every ~1 second)

htsfSyncEnable.desc: Set to 1 to enable high-resolution (ns-level) TSF synchronization, 0 otherwise

htsfRfSyncKpKi.desc: RF HTSF sync PI control loop coefficients (bits 16:31 RF_KP, bits 0:15 RF_KI)

htsfPpsSyncKpKi.desc: PPS HTSF sync PI control loop coefficients (bits 16:31 PPS_KP, bits 0:15 PPS_KI)

mtpoEnabled.desc: Set to 1 to enable MTPO, 0 otherwise.  Has no effect in diversity or single tile modes

mtpoPhaseHysteresis_dBQ2.desc: Do not apply new MTPO phases unless the improvement exceeds this value (Q2 means x4)

fwStatsConfig.desc: Enable/disable categories of stats exported by firmware (tgfStatsType), e.g. 'TGF_STATS_BF'.

wpa_passphrase.desc: Default WPA pre-shared key, in ASCII passphrase format (8-63 characters)

wpa_passphrase_override.desc: Link-specific WPA pre-shared keys in ASCII passphrase format (8-63 characters). This is comprised of a map of neighbor radio MAC addresses to their passphrases. Note that the default passphrase is also still allowed by the authenticator.

community.desc: SNMP community with read-only access to all OIDs

source.desc: Allowed IPv6 source address or prefix

queueBufferingMaxMs.desc: [queue.buffering.max.ms] Delay in milliseconds to wait for messages in the producer queue to accumulate before constructing message batches (MessageSets) to transmit to brokers. A higher value allows larger and more effective (less overhead, improved compression) batches of messages to accumulate at the expense of increased message delivery latency.

queueBufferingMaxMessages.desc: [queue.buffering.max.messages] Maximum number of messages allowed on the producer queue. This queue is shared by all topics and partitions.

queueBufferingMaxKbytes.desc: [queue.buffering.max.kbytes] Maximum total message size sum allowed on the producer queue. This queue is shared by all topics and partitions. This property has higher priority than queue.buffering.max.messages.

batchNumMessages.desc: [batch.num.messages] Maximum number of messages batched in one MessageSet. The total MessageSet size is also limited by message.max.bytes.

enableIdempotence.desc: [enable.idempotence] When set to true, the producer will ensure that messages are successfully produced exactly once and in the original produce order.

compressionCodec.desc: [compression.codec] Compression codec to use for compressing message sets

compressionLevel.desc: [compression.level] Compression level parameter for algorithm selected by configuration property compression.codec. Higher values will result in better compression at the cost of more CPU usage. Usable range is algorithm-dependent: [0-9] for gzip; [0-12] for lz4; only 0 for snappy; -1 = codec-dependent default compression level.

messageTimeoutMs.desc: [message.timeout.ms] Local message timeout. This value is only enforced locally and limits the time a produced message waits for successful delivery. A time of 0 is infinite. This is the maximum time librdkafka may use to deliver a message (including retries). Delivery error occurs when either the retry count or the message timeout are exceeded.

accessToken.desc: Access token for the ODS endpoint

categoryId.desc: Category ID for submitting to ODS endpoint

accessToken.desc: Access token for the Pelican endpoint

enabled.desc: Enable data publishing to the aggregator

zmqSndHwm.desc: The ZMQ high watermark for outbound messages to the aggregator

openrStatsEnabled.desc: Collect counters from Open/R via Thrift

systemStatsCollectionInterval.desc: The interval (in seconds) at which system stats (ex. VPP, Open/R, network/process/memory/CPU counters) are collected. Depending on the desired stats frequency, this should either be set to 'defaultStatsInterval' or 'highFrequencyStatsInterval' (and may have a high impact on CPU usage).

defaultStatsInterval.desc: The interval (in seconds) at which stats are published to configured endpoints

highFrequencyStatsInterval.desc: The interval (in seconds) at which high-frequency stats are published to configured endpoints

statsBlacklist.desc: The stats block list, comprised of a map of group names to regex strings to block

highFrequencyStatsWhitelist.desc: The high-frequency stats whitelist, comprised of a map of group names to regex strings to allow

statsBufferSize.desc: The maximum number of queued stats (when reached, older stats are dropped)

eventLogsBufferSize.desc: The maximum number of queued events (when reached, older events are dropped)

convertToRate.desc: If enabled, convert counter-type stats into rates, otherwise publish as raw values

publishValueWithRate.desc: When this option and 'convertToRate' are both enabled, publish the raw values and rates for counter-type stats in two separate keys: '<keyName>' for the raw value and '<keyName>.rate' for the computed rate

managedConfig.desc: Determines whether the controller should manage the node's config

sshTrustedUserCAKeys.desc: The public keys for certificate authorities that are trusted to sign user certs for authentication

allowFactoryCA.desc: Determines whether to trust the default ssh cert authority installed on the node in addition to the ones listed in sshTrustedUserCAKeys

dnsServers.desc: Additional DNS server IPv6 addresses to install. Map keys can be arbitrary strings and are ignored

ntpServers.desc: NTP server hostnames or IPv6 addresses to install. Map keys can be arbitrary strings and are ignored

distributedIgnitionEnabled.desc: Determines whether the node should attempt to re-ignite links to neighbors as defined in its config

enabled.desc: Enable sending syslogs to a remote server

remoteHost.desc: The remote host to submit syslogs to (name or IP)

remotePort.desc: The UDP port on the remote host to submit syslogs to

protocol.desc: The remote host to submit syslogs to (name or IP)

selector.desc: The log selector field (in sysklogd format)

allowLinkLocal.desc: Allow any communications from fe80::/10 prefix

allowLoopback.desc: Allow ANY communications to Loopback Interface: DEBUGGING ONLY

tcpPorts.desc: Comma Separated list of TCP ports Overriding default target

udpPorts.desc: Comma Separated list of UDP ports Overriding default target

sources.desc: Map of log files for the fluentd agent to watch. Each map key will be used as the 'tag' for that log file.

endpoints.desc: Map of endpoints that fluentd will send logs to. The keys can be arbitrary strings and are ignored.

host.desc: Hostname or IP of the fluentd endpoint

port.desc: Port on which the fluentd endpoint listens

memBufLimit.desc: If non-zero, limit data ingestion for input plugins to the given amount of bytes via the 'Mem_Buf_Limit' setting. When estimating potential memory usage, note that this setting will apply to each log source independently, and output plugins may also consume additional memory (typically up to double the value here).

ESMC_ENABLED.desc: Whether to enable to the SyncE ESMC (Ethernet synchronization messaging channel) plugin in VPP to generate and handle ESMC protocol frames

HTSF_MAX_LOOP_SIZE.desc: Largest possible loop size in the network. To avoid timing loops in HTSF sync mode, nodes must wait at least TIMING_LOOP_MAX_SIZE*12 seconds before switching to a new HTSF source.

HTSF_SRC_MAC.desc: [Test-only] When using HTSF as the PPS or PTP source, only use HTSF messages from a given radio MAC address (default: select automatically)

PPS_TIMESTAMP_SOURCE.desc: PPS timestamp source for Wigig sectors in PPS sync mode

PTP_DEVICE.desc: Set the PTP hardware clock device (ex. /dev/ptp0)

PTP_TIMER_SOURCE.desc: PPS timestamp source for PTP timer synchronization

PTP_VPP_INTERFACE.desc: When using VPP for PTP-TC timestamping, set the timestamping interface name

PTP_VPP_OFFSET_NS.desc: When using VPP for PTP-TC timestamping, set the factory calibration constant (in nanoseconds) to compensate for internal timestamping bias

PTP_VPP_NXP_PORT.desc: When using VPP for PTP-TC timestamping, provide a comma-separated list of the NXP NPU timestamping port number(s), i.e. DPMAC indexes, on which to enable the one-step correction field update in hardware (0 = disabled, use software timestamping)

PTP_VSC_CTRL_SOCKET.desc: When using a VSC 10G 'Malibu' PHY, set to enable PTP-TC timestamping and use a given control socket path for LTC clock synchronization (if 'PTP_TIMER_SOURCE' is set)

PTP_VSC_PORT.desc: When using a VSC 10G 'Malibu' PHY, select the port used for PTP-TC timestamping and ESMC input/output (default = 0)

topologyName.desc: The name of the topology that this node belongs to

nodeType.desc: The type of this node (1: CN, 2: DN)

distributedIgnitionNumColors.desc: The number of colors used to bucket radios for distributed ignition

radioInfo.desc: Information about each of the node's radios

distributedIgnitionColor.desc: The color of this radio, used for bucketing in distributed ignition

site.desc: Information about the node's physical location

altitude.desc: The altitude of this site in meters

accuracy.desc: The accuracy radius of this site's location in meters

neighborInfo.desc: Information about wireless neighbors that this node could ignite (as the initiator)

controlSuperframe.desc: The control superframe for this link

nodeType.desc: The type of the neighbor node (1: CN, 2: DN)

golayIdx.desc: The neighbor's transmission and receive golay codes

zoneNodes.desc: Comma-separated list of nodes in Open/R name format that are in this node's zone

tunnelParams.desc: Extra parameters needed for some tunnel types

primaryTunnelName.desc: Name of the primary tunnel (valid if this is a backup tunnel)

cpeConfig.desc: The CPE interface configuration. Map keys are CPE interface names

prefix.desc: Prefix for CPE network segment. The IPv6 address ::1 will be assigned to Terragraph CPE interface and serve as the gateway address for CPE devices

dhcpRelay.desc: DHCPv6 Relay configuration for CPE interface.

enabled.desc: Enable DHCPv6 relay for this CPE interface.

enterpriseId.desc: Optional Enterprise ID for DHCPv6 Option 37.

remoteIdMac.desc: Optional Remote ID for DHCPv6 Option 37. Default is interface MAC address.

queue.desc: VPP-DPDK HQoS queue for traffic class

radius_server_ip.desc: IP address of auth server (i.e. radius) for hostapd

radius_server_port.desc: Auth server port (i.e. radius server port) for hostapd

private_key_path.desc: Path for node private key file
